intro: Cyrtandra pandurata, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a vine or shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra pandurata plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
